From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin sternūtāre.

Verb

[edit]

estornudar (first-person singular indicative present estornudo, past participle estornudáu)

  1. to sneeze (expel air as a reflex)
    Synonym: espirriar

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • estorníu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “estornudar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “estornudar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin sternūtāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /estoɾnuˈdaɾ/ [es.t̪oɾ.nuˈð̞aɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: es‧tor‧nu‧dar

Verb

[edit]

estornudar (first-person singular present estornudo, first-person singular preterite estornudé, past participle estornudado)

  1. (intransitive) to sneeze
    Synonym: (Asturias, León and Zamora) esperriar

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
